Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build] fix r8 license build failure" (#2539) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We are seeing this on non-Windows platforms:

    make: *** No rule to make target 'external//r8/LICENSE', needed by 'ThirdPartyNotices.txt'.  Stop.

It turns out that if you put a `LICENSE` file in `src`, things don't
quite work right.

This license should just be specified with `<LicenseText>` item
metadata instead of using a file.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] disable aapt2 by default" (#2546) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2501

This reverts one line of 0f91aea.

We have a circular dependency problem with aapt2...

- `<Aapt2Compile/>` creates `*.flata` files, but needs
  `<ConvertCustomView/>` to have run.
- `<GenerateJavaStubs/>` creates `acw-map.txt`.
- `<ConvertCustomView/>` needs `acw-map.txt` to work.

If I try calling no. 3 earlier, `acw-map.txt` doesn't exist yet...

So it seems like custom views aren't getting fixed up at all when
aapt2 is enabled...

The final apk will contain non-fixed up custom views, but the
`obj\Debug\res` directory will be correct.

For now let's disable `$(AndroidUseAapt2)` by default, and revisit
after the holiday.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Mono.Android] BiometricErrorCode, not BiometricsErrorCode" (#2545) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: http://build.devdiv.io/740112
Fixes: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/399276/missing-method-bindings-in-androidhardwarebiometri.html

Commit f9a7cfc0 -- which enumified API-28 -- contained a typo: instead
of `Android.Hardware.Biometrics.BiometricErrorCode`, it used
`Android.Hardware.Biometrics.BiometricsErrorCode` (not added `s`).
Consequently,
`Android.Hardware.Biometrics.BiometricPrompt.AuthenticationCallback.OnAuthenticationError()`
wasn't bound:

	warning BG8800: Unknown parameter type Android.Hardware.Biometrics.BiometricsErrorCode in method OnAuthenticationError in managed type Android.Hardware.Biometrics.BiometricPrompt.AuthenticationCallback.

Fix the typo, so that
`BiometricPrompt.AuthenticationCallback.OnAuthenticationError()` may
be bound as expected.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Android] Check if Drawable is null in Draw override" (#4783) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
Forms just set the default Drawable to "Transparent" so the Drawable is never null. 3rd party libraries that implement their own handlers won't do this though so need to check if Drawable is null. 

### Issues Resolved ### 
- fixes #4782

### Platforms Affected ### 
- Android

### Testing Procedure ###
There aren't any.  I added a custom renderer UI test to replicate setting Drawable to null but there's no way to manually test outside of just making sure changes don't appear to cause more breaks.
You can check the ImageButtonGallery just to makes sure all seems correct

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [ ] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard
